Welcome to users project’s documentation!¶

REST API repository USERS¶

async source.repository.users.create_user(body: UserSchema, db: AsyncSession, consumer: Consumer)¶

The create_user function creates a new user.

Parameters:

  • body – UserSchema: Validate the request body

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the function

  • consumer – Consumer: Create the user

Returns:

A user object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async source.repository.users.delete_user(user_id: int, db: AsyncSession, consumer: Consumer)¶

The delete_user function deletes a user from the database.

Parameters:

  • user_id – int: Specify the user that will be deleted

  • db – AsyncSession: Create a connection to the database

  • consumer – Consumer: Filter the user by consumer

Returns:

A user object if the user was deleted, otherwise it returns none

Doc-author:

Trelent

async source.repository.users.get_all_users(limit: int, offset: int, db: AsyncSession)¶

The get_all_users function returns a list of all users in the database.

Parameters:

  • limit – int: Limit the number of results returned

  • offset – int: Specify the number of rows to skip

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A list of user objects

Doc-author:

Trelent

async source.repository.users.get_user(user_id: int, db: AsyncSession, consumer: Consumer)¶

The get_user function is used to retrieve a user from the database.

Parameters:

  • user_id – int: Specify the user id of the user that we want to retrieve

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass in the database session

  • consumer – Consumer: Filter the user by consumer

Returns:

An object of the user class

Doc-author:

Trelent

async source.repository.users.get_users(limit: int, offset: int, db: AsyncSession, consumer: Consumer)¶

The get_users function returns a list of users from the database.

Parameters:

  • limit – int: Limit the number of users returned

  • offset – int: Specify the number of records to skip

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the function

  • consumer – Consumer: Filter the users by consumer

Returns:

A list of user objects

Doc-author:

Trelent

async source.repository.users.get_users_birth(limit: int, db: AsyncSession, consumer: Consumer)¶

The get_users_birth function returns a list of users whose birthdays are within the next limit days.

Parameters:

  • limit – int: Limit the number of days to search for birthdays

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the function

  • consumer – Consumer: Filter the search by consumer

Returns:

A list of users with a birth date in the next limit days

Doc-author:

Trelent

async source.repository.users.get_users_by(first_name: str = None, second_name: str = None, email_add: str = None, db: AsyncSession = None, consumer: Consumer = None)¶

The get_users_by function is used to search for users in the database. It takes a first_name, second_name and email address as arguments. If any of these are provided, it will return all users that match the criteria.

Parameters:

  • first_name – str: Search for a user with the first name

  • second_name – str: Filter the users by their second name

  • email_add – str: Search for a user by email address

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass in the database session to be used for querying

  • consumer – Consumer: Filter the users by consumer

Returns:

A list of user objects

Doc-author:

Trelent

async source.repository.users.update_user(user_id: int, body: UserSchema, db: AsyncSession, consumer: Consumer)¶
The update_user function updates a user in the database.
Args:

user_id (int): The id of the user to update. body (UserSchema): A UserSchema object containing all fields that should be updated for this user.

Note that only fields included in this schema will be updated, and any other fields will remain unchanged.

db (AsyncSession): An async session with an open transaction to use for querying and updating data from the database. consumer(Consumer): The consumer associated with this request, used as a filter when querying users from the

Parameters:

  • user_id – int: Identify the user in the database

  • body – UserSchema: Pass the user data that will be used to update a user

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the function

  • consumer – Consumer: Ensure that the user is only updated if they are a consumer of the company

Returns:

A user object

Doc-author:

Trelent

REST API repository Consumers¶

async source.repository.consumers.confirmed_email(email: str, db: AsyncSession) → None¶

The confirmed_email function marks a user as confirmed in the database.

Parameters:

  • email – str: Specify the email address of the user to be confirmed

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

None

Doc-author:

Trelent

async source.repository.consumers.create_user(body: UserSchema, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶
The create_user function creates a new user in the database.

It takes an email, username, and password as input. The function then hashes the password using bcrypt and stores it in the database.

Parameters:

  • body – UserSchema: Validate the request body

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database connection to the function

Returns:

A consumer object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async source.repository.consumers.get_user_by_email(email: str, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶
The get_user_by_email function takes an email address and returns the user associated with that email.

If no user is found, None is returned.

Parameters:

  • email – str: Pass in the email address of the user to be retrieved

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass in the database session

Returns:

A user object or none

Doc-author:

Trelent

async source.repository.consumers.update_avatar_url(email: str, url: str | None, db: AsyncSession) → Consumer¶

The update_avatar_url function updates the avatar url of a user.

Parameters:

  • email – str: Find the user in the database

  • url – str | None: Determine if the avatar url is a string or none

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass in the database session to be used for this function

Returns:

The consumer object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async source.repository.consumers.update_password(email: str, password: str, db: AsyncSession) → None¶

The update_password function updates the password of a user in the database.

Parameters:

  • email – str: Specify the email of the user to update

  • password:str – Update the password of a user

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

None

Doc-author:

Trelent

async source.repository.consumers.update_token(user: Consumer, token: str | None, db: AsyncSession)¶

The update_token function updates the refresh token for a user.

Parameters:

  • user – Consumer: Identify the user that is being updated

  • token – str | None: Update the refresh token of a user

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A coroutine object

Doc-author:

Trelent

REST API routes USERS¶

async source.routes.users.create_user(body: UserSchema, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), c_user: Consumer = Depends(get_current_user))¶
The create_user function creates a new user.

The create_user function is used to create a new user in the database. — tags:

  • users

parameters:

  • name: body in: body # This means that the request will be sent as JSON data, not as form-data or query string parameters. See https://swagger.io/docs/specification/describing-request-body/. You can also use &quot;formData&quot; if you want to send it as form data instead of JSON (but I don’t think this is

Parameters:

  • body – UserSchema: Validate the request body against the userschema

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the database session

  • c_user – Consumer: Get the current user

async source.routes.users.delete_user(user_id: int = Path(PydanticUndefined), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), c_user: Consumer = Depends(get_current_user))¶

The delete_user function deletes a user from the database.

Parameters:

  • user_id – int: Get the user id from the url

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the repository

  • c_user – Consumer: Get the current user from the auth_service

Returns:

A user object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async source.routes.users.get_all_users(limit: int = Query(10), offset: int = Query(0), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), c_user: Consumer = Depends(get_current_user))¶
The get_all_users function returns a list of all users in the database.

The limit and offset parameters are used to paginate the results.

Parameters:

  • limit – int: Limit the amount of users returned

  • ge – Set the minimum value of the parameter

  • le – Limit the maximum number of results returned

  • offset – int: Skip a certain number of users

  • ge – Specify the minimum value that can be passed to the limit parameter

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the function

  • c_user – Consumer: Get the current user from the database

Returns:

A list of users

Doc-author:

Trelent

async source.routes.users.get_user(user_id: int = Path(PydanticUndefined), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), c_user: Consumer = Depends(get_current_user))¶
The get_user function returns a user object based on the user_id passed in.

If no such user exists, it will return an HTTP 404 error.

Parameters:

  • user_id – int: Get the user_id from the path

  • db – AsyncSession: Get a database connection from the dependency injection system

  • c_user – Consumer: Get the current user from the auth_service

Returns:

A user object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async source.routes.users.get_users(limit: int = Query(10), offset: int = Query(0), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), c_user: Consumer = Depends(get_current_user))¶
The get_users function returns a list of users.

The limit and offset parameters are used to paginate the results. The c_user parameter is used to determine if the user has access to this endpoint.

Parameters:

  • limit – int: Limit the number of users returned

  • ge – Set the minimum value of the limit parameter

  • le – Limit the maximum number of users that can be returned

  • offset – int: Skip the first n users

  • ge – Set a minimum value for the limit parameter

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database connection to the function

  • c_user – Consumer: Get the current user from the database

Returns:

A list of users, but the documentation says that it returns a user object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async source.routes.users.get_users_birth(limit: int = Query(7), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), c_user: Consumer = Depends(get_current_user))¶
The get_users_birth function returns a list of users with their birthdays in the next 7 days.

The limit parameter is optional and defaults to 7, but can be set to any number between 7 and 100.

Parameters:

  • limit – int: Limit the amount of users returned

  • ge – Set a minimum value for the limit parameter

  • le – Limit the number of users returned

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the repository function

  • c_user – Consumer: Get the current user from the auth_service

Returns:

A list of users with the same birth date as the current user

Doc-author:

Trelent

async source.routes.users.get_users_by(first_name: str = Query(None), second_name: str = Query(None), email_add: str = Query(None), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), c_user: Consumer = Depends(get_current_user))¶
The get_users_by function is used to search for users by first name, second name or email address.

The function will return a list of all the users that match the search criteria. If no user matches the search criteria an empty list will be returned.

Parameters:

  • first_name – str: Pass the value of the first_name query parameter

  • min_length – Specify the minimum length of the query string

  • description – Create a description of the parameter in the swagger documentation

  • second_name – str: Search for users by their second name

  • min_length – Set a minimum length for the query string

  • description – Provide a description for the parameter

  • email_add – str: Search for users by email address

  • min_length – Set the minimum length of the query string

  • description – Provide a description of the parameter in the swagger documentation

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database connection to the repository function

  • c_user – Consumer: Get the current user

Returns:

A list of users

Doc-author:

Trelent

async source.routes.users.update_user(body: UserSchema, user_id: int = Path(PydanticUndefined), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), c_user: Consumer = Depends(get_current_user))¶
The update_user function updates a user in the database.

The function takes an id, body and db as parameters. It returns the updated user.

Parameters:

  • body – UserSchema: Validate the body of the request

  • user_id – int: Get the user_id from the url

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the repository function

  • c_user – Consumer: Get the current user

Returns:

The updated user

Doc-author:

Trelent

REST API routes Auth¶

async source.routes.auth.confirmed_email(token: str, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶
The confirmed_email function is used to confirm a user’s email address.

It takes the token from the URL and uses it to get the user’s email address. Then, it checks if that user exists in our database, and if they do not exist, we return an error message saying &quot;Verification error&quot;. If they do exist in our database, we check whether or not their account has already been confirmed. If their account has already been confirmed, then we return a message saying &quot;Your email is already confirmed&quot;. Otherwise (if their account hasn’t yet been confirmed),

Parameters:

  • token – str: Get the token from the url

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the database connection

Returns:

A dictionary with a message key and value

Doc-author:

Trelent

async source.routes.auth.login(body: OAuth2PasswordRequestForm = Depends(OAuth2PasswordRequestForm), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

The login function is used to authenticate a user.

Parameters:

  • body – OAuth2PasswordRequestForm: Get the username and password from the request body

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the database session

Returns:

A dictionary with the access token and refresh token

Doc-author:

Trelent

async source.routes.auth.new_password(token: str, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶
The new_password function is used to update a user’s password.

It takes in the token and db as parameters, and returns a message indicating that the password has been updated.

Parameters:

  • token – str: Get the token from the request body

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database connection to the function

Returns:

A dict with a message

Doc-author:

Trelent

async source.routes.auth.refresh_token(credentials: HTTPAuthorizationCredentials = Depends(HTTPBearer), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶
The refresh_token function is used to refresh the access token.

The function will take in a refresh token and return an access_token, a new refresh_token, and the type of token (bearer).

Parameters:

  • credentials – HTTPAuthorizationCredentials: Get the refresh token from the request header

  • db – AsyncSession: Create a database session

Returns:

A dictionary with the following keys:

Doc-author:

Trelent

async source.routes.auth.request_email(body: RequestEmail, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

The request_email function is used to send an email to the user with a link that will allow them to confirm their email address. The function takes in a RequestEmail object, which contains the email of the user who wants to confirm their account. It then checks if there is already a confirmed user with that email address, and if so returns an error message saying as much. If not, it sends an email containing a confirmation link.

Parameters:

  • body – RequestEmail: Validate the request body

  • background_tasks – BackgroundTasks: Add a task to the background tasks queue

  • request – Request: Get the base_url of the application

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the database session

Returns:

A dict, but the return type is a response

Doc-author:

Trelent

async source.routes.auth.reset_password(body: PasswordForm, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶
The reset_password function is used to reset a user’s password.

It takes in the email of the user, and then sends an email with a link to reset their password. The link will expire after 1 hour.

Parameters:

  • body – PasswordForm: Get the data from the request body

  • background_tasks – BackgroundTasks: Add a task to the background tasks queue

  • request – Request: Get the base_url of the application

  • db – AsyncSession: Create a database session

Returns:

A dictionary with a message

Doc-author:

Trelent

async source.routes.auth.signup(body: UserSchema, bt: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

The signup function creates a new user in the database.

Parameters:

  • body – UserSchema: Get the request body from the user

  • bt – BackgroundTasks: Add a task to the background queue

  • request – Request: Get the base_url of the request

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the database session

Returns:

A userschema object

Doc-author:

Trelent

REST API routes user_profile¶

async source.routes.user_profile.get_current_user(file: UploadFile = File(PydanticUndefined), user: Consumer = Depends(get_current_user), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶
The get_current_user function is used to update the avatar url of a user.

The function takes in an UploadFile object, which contains the file that will be uploaded to Cloudinary. It also takes in a Consumer object, which represents the current logged-in user and is obtained from auth_service’s get_current_user function. Finally it takes in an AsyncSession object, which represents our database session and is obtained from get_db().

Parameters:

  • file – UploadFile: Get the file that is being uploaded

  • user – Consumer: Get the current user from the database

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the database session

:param : Get the current user from the database :return: The following error: :doc-author: Trelent

async create_access_token(data: dict, expires_delta: float | None = None)¶

The create_access_token function creates a new access token for the user.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of a class

  • data – dict: Pass the data to be encoded in the access token

  • expires_delta – Optional[float]: Set the time in seconds for which the token is valid

Returns:

A string

Doc-author:

Trelent

create_email_token(data: dict)¶

The create_email_token function takes a dictionary of data and returns a JWT token. The token is encoded with the SECRET_KEY and ALGORITHM defined in the class. The iat (issued at) claim is set to datetime.utcnow() and exp (expiration time) is set to one day from now.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • data – dict: Pass the data to be encoded in the token

Returns:

A token

Doc-author:

Trelent

async create_refresh_token(data: dict, expires_delta: float | None = None)¶
The create_refresh_token function creates a refresh token for the user.
Args:

data (dict): A dictionary containing the user’s id and username. expires_delta (Optional[float]): The number of seconds until the refresh token expires. Defaults to None, which sets it to 7 days from now.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of a class

  • data – dict: Pass the data to be encoded

  • expires_delta – Optional[float]: Set the expiration time of the refresh token

Returns:

A refresh token that is encoded with the user’s data and a scope of refresh_token

Doc-author:

Trelent

async decode_refresh_token(refresh_token: str)¶
The decode_refresh_token function takes a refresh token and decodes it.

If the scope is ‘refresh_token’, then we return the email address of the user. Otherwise, we raise an HTTPException with status code 401 (UNAUTHORIZED) and detail message ‘Invalid scope for token’.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • refresh_token – str: Pass the refresh token to the function

Returns:

The email of the user who is trying to refresh their access token

Doc-author:

Trelent

async get_current_user(token: str = Depends(OAuth2PasswordBearer), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶
The get_current_user function is a dependency that will be used in the

protected endpoints. It takes a token as an argument and returns the user object if it exists, otherwise it raises an exception.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of a class

  • token – str: Get the token from the request header

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the database session

Returns:

A user object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async get_email_from_token(token: str)¶

The get_email_from_token function takes a token as an argument and returns the email address associated with that token. The function uses the jwt library to decode the token, which is then used to retrieve the email address from within it.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • token – str: Pass in the token that was sent to the user’s email address

Returns:

The email address associated with the token

Doc-author:

Trelent

async get_password_from_token(token: str)¶

The get_password_from_token function takes a token as an argument and returns the password that was encoded in the token. The function uses jwt to decode the token, which is then used to return the password.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of a class

  • token – str: Pass in the token that was generated when the user signed up

Returns:

The password from the token

Doc-author:

Trelent

get_password_hash(password: str)¶
The get_password_hash function takes a password as input and returns the hash of that password.

The function uses the pwd_context object to generate a hash from the given password.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • password – str: Pass the password to be hashed

Returns:

A password hash

Doc-author:

Trelent

oauth2_scheme = <fastapi.security.oauth2.OAuth2PasswordBearer object>¶
pwd_context = <CryptContext>¶
verify_password(plain_password, hashed_password)¶
The verify_password function takes a plain-text password and the hashed version of that password,

and returns True if they match, False otherwise. This is used to verify that the user’s login credentials are correct.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • plain_password – Get the password from the user

  • hashed_password – Check if the password matches with the hashed_password

Returns:

A boolean value

Doc-author:

Trelent

REST API service Email¶

async source.services.email.send_email(email: EmailStr, username: str, host: str)¶
The send_email function sends an email to the user with a link to verify their email address.
The function takes in three arguments:

-email: the user’s email address, which is used as a unique identifier for them. -username: the username of the user, which is displayed in the body of the message. -host: this is used as part of constructing a URL that will be sent to users so they can verify their account.

Parameters:

  • email – EmailStr: Specify the email address of the recipient

  • username – str: Pass the username to the template

  • host – str: Construct a url that will be sent to the user so they can verify their account

Returns:

A coroutine object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async source.services.email.send_password_email(email: EmailStr, username: str, password, host: str)¶
The send_password_email function sends an email to the user with a link to reset their password.
The function takes in the following parameters:

  • email: EmailStr, which is a string that represents an email address.

  • username: str, which is a string that represents the username of the user who requested

    their password be reset.

  • password: str, which is a string that represents the new randomly generated temporary

    password for this user’s account. This will be used as part of our JWT token verification process later on in this tutorial series when we implement our frontend

Parameters:

  • email – EmailStr: Validate the email address

  • username – str: Pass the username to the template

  • password – Send the password to the user

  • host – str: Pass the host of the website to be used in the email template

Returns:

A coroutine object

Doc-author:

Trelent
